text: The Vision of a Small Horn that Oppresses Israel and Threatens the Temple

In the third year \add of\add* the kingdom of Belshazzar the king, a vision appeared ⸤to me, Daniel⸥,\f + \fr 8:1 \ft Literally “I Daniel” \f* after the one that appeared to me ⸤previously⸥.\f + \fr 8:1 \ft Literally “in the beginning” \f*

And I saw in the vision, ⸤and when I saw⸥,\f + \fr 8:2 \ft Literally “and it was at my seeing” \f* I \add was\add* in Susa, the citadel that \add was\add* in the province of Elam. And I saw in the vision, and ⸤I myself⸥\f + \fr 8:2 \ft Literally “I, I was” \f* was at the stream of Ulai.\f + \fr 8:2 \ft Or “Ulai Canal” (NASB); “stream of the Ulai” (NEB) \f*

And I lifted up my eyes and I saw, and look! A ram\f + \fr 8:3 \ft Hebrew “One ram” \f* standing ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 8:3 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* the stream, and ⸤it had⸥\f + \fr 8:3 \ft Literally “for it” \f* two horns, and the horns \add were\add* long, but the one \add was\add* longer than the second, and the longer \add one\add* came up ⸤after the other one⸥.\f + \fr 8:3 \ft Literally “in the behind of the other” \f*

I saw the ram charging westward and northward and southward, and ⸤none of the beasts stood before it⸥,\f + \fr 8:4 \ft Literally “all \fq the \ft beasts not they withstood to the face of him” \f* and there was no rescuing from ⸤its power⸥,\f + \fr 8:4 \ft Literally “its hand” \f* and it did ⸤what it wanted⸥\f + \fr 8:4 \ft Literally “according to its will” \f* and it became strong.\f + \fr 8:4 \ft Or “it/he magnified itself/himself” \f*

And I was considering \add this\add*, and look, a he-goat coming from the west across the face of the whole earth, and \add it\add* was not touching the ground;\f + \fr 8:5 \ft Or “earth,” or “land” \f* and the he-goat \add had\add* ⸤a conspicuous horn⸥\f + \fr 8:5 \ft Literally “a horn of vision” \f* between its eyes.

Then it came toward the ram ⸤that had the two horns⸥\f + \fr 8:6 \ft Literally “the owner of the two horns” \f* that I saw standing ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 8:6 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* the stream, and it ran at it with\f + \fr 8:6 \ft Or “in” \f* the rage of its power.

And I saw it approaching the ram and it was furious at it, and it struck the ram, and it broke its two horns, and ⸤there was not strength in the ram to stand before him⸥,\f + \fr 8:7 \ft Literally “and not was strength in the ram to withstand to the face of him” \f* and he threw it down to the ground and trampled it, ⸤and there was no one who could rescue the ram⸥\f + \fr 8:7 \ft Literally “and not he/it was one rescuing” \f* from its power.

And the he-goat grew ⸤exceedingly great⸥,\f + \fr 8:8 \ft Literally “until much” \f* and ⸤at the height of its power⸥\f + \fr 8:8 \ft Literally “and at his being powerful” \f* the great horn was broken, and four conspicuous horns\f + \fr 8:8 \ft LXX reads “others” here for “conspicuous.” The words in Hebrew can be confused for each other \f* came up in place of it toward the four winds of heaven.

⸤And from one of them⸥\f + \fr 8:9 \ft Literally “And from the one from them” \f* came forth \add a\add* horn, ⸤a little one⸥,\f + \fr 8:9 \ft Literally “one from little” \f* and it grew exceedingly\f + \fr 8:9 \ft Or “pre-eminently” \f* toward the south, and toward the east, and toward the beautiful land.
And it grew up to the host of heaven, and it threw down to the ground some of the host and some of the stars and trampled them.
Even against the prince of the hosts it acted arrogantly and took away from him the regular burnt offering, and the place of his sanctuary was overthrown.

And on account of transgression, \add the\add* host was given over \add to the horn\add* in addition to the regular burnt offering. And it cast down truth to the ground, and it ⸤acted⸥,\f + \fr 8:12 \ft Literally “did” \f* and it had success.

And I heard a certain holy one speaking, and a certain other holy one said to the specific one ⸤who was speaking⸥,\f + \fr 8:13 \ft Literally “the \fq one \ft speaking” \f* “⸤For how long⸥\f + \fr 8:13 \ft Literally “Until when” \f* \add is\add* the vision \add concerning\add* the regular burnt offering, and the transgression \add that\add* makes desolate, and \add the\add* giving over \add of the\add* sanctuary and \add the\add* host to trampling?”
And he said to me, “For two thousand three hundred evenings and mornings, then \add the\add* sanctuary will be restored.”
Gabriel Gives Angelic Help and Interprets the Vision

⸤And then⸥\f + \fr 8:15 \ft Literally “And it happened” \f* when I, Daniel, saw the vision, and I was seeking understanding, there was \add one\add* standing before me with \add the\add* appearance of a man.
And I heard \add the\add* voice of a human at \add the\add* Ulai, and he called and said, “Gabriel, \add make\add* this \add man\add* understand the vision.”

And he came beside ⸤where I was standing⸥,\f + \fr 8:17 \ft Literally “my standing” \f* and ⸤when he came⸥\f + \fr 8:17 \ft Literally “at his coming” \f* I became terrified and I fell prostrate on my face. And he said to me, “Understand, son of man,\f + \fr 8:17 \ft Or “mortal,” or “son of humankind” \f* that the vision \add is\add* for \add the\add* time of \add the\add* end.”
And ⸤when he spoke⸥\f + \fr 8:18 \ft Literally “at his speaking” \f* with me I fell into a trance with my face to the ground, and he touched me and made me stand on by feet.
And he said, “Look, I am making known to you what will happen in the period of wrath,\f + \fr 8:19 \ft Or “the wrath” \f* for \add it refers\add* to \add the\add* appointed time of \add the\add* end.
“The ram that you saw ⸤who had two horns⸥\f + \fr 8:20 \ft Literally “the owner of the two horns” \f* \add represents\add* the kings of Media and Persia.
“And the hairy he-goat \add is\add* the ⸤kingdom⸥\f + \fr 8:21 \ft Literally “king” \f* of Greece, and the great horn that \add is\add* between his eyes—he \add is\add* the first king.

And the \add horn\add* \add that\add* was broken, and \add then\add* there arose four \add horns\add* in place of it—\add these are\add* four kingdoms \add that\add* will arise from \add his\add* nation, but not with his power.
And at the end of their kingdom, when the transgressions are completed, a king will arise, fierce in countenance and skilled in riddles.

And his power will grow, but not by his \add own\add* power, and he will cause fearful destruction, and he will succeed and ⸤he will act⸥,\f + \fr 8:24 \ft Literally “he will do” \f* and he will destroy \add the\add* mighty and \add the\add* people of \add the\add* holy ones.\f + \fr 8:24 \ft Or “saints” \f*

And by his planning\f + \fr 8:25 \ft Or “cunning” \f* he will make a success of deceit by\f + \fr 8:25 \ft Hebrew “in” \f* his hand, and in his ⸤mind⸥\f + \fr 8:25 \ft Literally “heart” \f* he will ⸤boast⸥,\f + \fr 8:25 \ft Literally “magnify himself” \f* and in \add their\add* ease he will destroy many, and \add even\add* against \add the\add* prince of princes he will rise up, and he will be broken, \add but\add* not by human hands.

And the vision of the evening and the morning that has been ⸤described⸥,\f + \fr 8:26 \ft Literally “told” \f* it \add is\add* true; and you, seal \add up\add* the vision, for ⸤it refers to many days to come⸥.”\f + \fr 8:26 \ft Literally “for to days many” \f*

And I, Daniel, was overcome, and I became ill for \add some\add* days, and I ⸤performed⸥\f + \fr 8:27 \ft Literally “did” \f* the business of the king, and I was dismayed over the vision and ⸤I did not understand it⸥.\f + \fr 8:27 \ft Literally “there was not understanding” \f*
